document_title: Grade 2 fatty liver: Causes, symptoms and treatment
subsection_name: gan-nhiem-mo-do-2.json_6_Is second-degree fatty liver severe or mild?
subsection_content:
Grade two fatty liver is moderate. Although not life-threatening, if left untreated, fatty liver disease will quickly become more severe and the risk of hepatitis and cirrhosis will also increase.

As soon as symptoms or diagnosis of the disease occur, patients should proactively seek reputable medical facilities for examination and timely intervention to prevent dangerous complications.
